gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਪੁਹਪ ਧੰਨਿਅਾ ਫੁਲੀ ਰਾੲਿ ਬੇਲੰ ||
translation: Or it may be Rati (the wife of god of love) or it may be the superb creeper of flowers.

transliteration: Taje An Te Baas(u) Channdaa Phulelan||21||189||
translation: The fragrance of the flowers of champa (Michelia champacca) was emanating from her limbs.21.189.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਦੇਵ ਕੰਨਿਅਾ ਪ੍ਰਿਥੀ ਲੋਕ ਡੋਲੈ ||
translation: It seemed as if a heavenly damsel was roaming on the earth,

transliteration: Didhau Rudra Beejan Phirai Maddh(i) Baalan||
translation: Or a Yaksha or Kinnar woman was busy in her frolics,

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਬੀਜੰ ਫਿਰੈ ਮੱਧਿ ਬਾਲੰ ||
transliteration: Kidhau Rudra Beejan Phirai Maddh(i) Baalan||
translation: Or the semen of god Shiva had strayed in the form of young damsel,

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਪਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਨੰ ਨਚੈ ਕੳੁਲ ਨਾਲੰ ||੨੨||੧੯੦||
transliteration: Kidhau Patra Paanan Nachai Kaul Naalan||22||190||
translation: Or the drops of water were dancing on the lotus leaf.22.190.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਰਾਗ ਮਾਲਾ ਰਚੀ ਰੰਗ ਰੂਪੰ ||
translation: It seemed as if a wreath of musical modes was presenting itself in colour and form;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ੲਿਸਤ੍ਰਿ ਰਾਜਾ ਰਚੀ ਭੂਪ ਭੂਪੰ ||
transliteration: Kidhau Istri Raajaa Rachi Bhoop Bhoopan||
translation: Or the Lord, king of kings, had created her as the Sovereign of beautiful women;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਨਾਗ ਕੰਨਿਅਾ ਕਿਧੌ ਬਾਸਵੀ ਹੈ ||
translation: Or she was the daughter of a Naga or Basve, the wife of Sheshanaga;
Or she was the charming replica of Sankhani, Chitrani or Padmini (9 types of women).23.191.
Her wonderful and infinite beauty glistened like a painting.
She was most elegant and most youthful.
She was most knowledgeable and adept in scientific works.

gurmukhi: ਪੜੈ ਕੰਠ ਬਿਦਿਅਾ ਸੁ ਬਿਦਿਅਾਦਿ ਧਰਮੰ ||੨੪||੧੯੨||
transliteration: Pudai Kanth Bidiaa Su Bidiaadh Dharman||24||192||
translation: She had all learning at her finger ends and was thus an adept in the discipline.24.192.
